review: TGI Friday's holds a special place in my heart. Many times when my ex-bf/friend and I would go on dates we would go to DuClaw for the drinks and then Friday's for food since their kitchen stays open later and plenty of NFL Sundays were spent at the bar. They have pretty good food deals from time to time and the music is loud but it didn't really bother us, we were amused. I absolutely love love LOVE the Ultimate Mojito, its the only drink I usually get here. Other than that the drink specials aren't really good, so thats the one downside. I say if your looking for a little fun in good old Bowie, stop thru. I will say that although it stays crowded we've never had to wait more than 20 mins tops for a seat. Even though there are cops that stand guard I've never had an issue or felt unsafe here. GET THE CHICKEN COBB SALAD! Sorry that thing is perfect every time I get it, its quite amazing.
Food was good, sat at the bar area and did not get the best of service. All and all a good experience

Everything about my original review still stands.  This place is super loud and the clientele tends to be on the rowdier side, even with a cop being stationed in the restaurant.   Service is ridiculously slow and our waitress went incognito on several occasions.   All that being said, I can bump this place up a star for their spinach dip and their new salted caramel cake.   The spinach dip is old faithful at Fridays.  Regardless of how bad the service is as well as the entrees, this appetizer is consistently good.  It features spinach, artichoke hearts, bell peppers and sauteed onions blended with Parmigiano and Romano cheeses, then topped with diced tomatoes.  Tostada chips are your dipping/scooping vehicles.  So creamy with a great cheesy flavor that is balanced without being overwhelming.  The dish comes together perfectly and is great for sharing.     The salted caramel cake is fantastic.  It is vanilla cake layered with vanilla bean pudding and caramel crunch, then drizzled with a salted caramel glaze.  The sweet/salty flavors complement each other well and offer a fun contrast.  The caramel crunch offers a nice texture change up.  The dessert was a little heavy on the caramel, which is a little assertive but just the way I like it.  Nice portion size that is very rich and filling.  My sweet tooth called and congratulated me on a great choice! If you can tolerate loud and obnoxious patrons, aloof servers, long waits for your orders and generally questionable menu options, these two choices may leave you mildly surprised.

Had a great time here on Friday. The drinks were pretty decently priced, very strong and came quickly. The food was good. I had the dragonfire salmon and it was amazing, perfectly cooked. I don't understand all the negative reviews. My date & I had a nice time, our waiter was very courteous and didn't even complain that we were there for nearly 2 hours. Overall, I had a great time and enjoyed the experience. I think people have to remember that this isn't a 5-star restaurant, it is a chain restaurant that cannot control who comes in to dine and drink. I will definitely be back for happy hour as I have heard great things about their HH specials.

So folks if u follow me it appears it has been a while since I ve partaken in the fine world of restaurant dining. Well you would be absolutely correct. You might ask what do I win? Well your prize is the truth... its 2012 and it's the great recession. This past Friday I was lucky to have a super nice friend take me out and although it was just TGI Friday's we picked the best night. The server was super polite. Even gave us a to-go cup for our refill. I ordered the three course $12.99 special. First course, I ordered the stupid wedge salad. Really a wedge of iceberg lettuce on my plate. Even a rabbit wants a carrot every now and then. The entree was delicious I had the salmon which was succulent and out of sight. My wonderful friend had the fried shrimp with only Fridays quality seasoned fries. Yum-o was their reply when I asked how they liked their meal. To top it all off the Oreo desert was presented so cute I felt guilty devouring every lil morsel. The manager on shift stopped by at the end of our dinner and of course  I had to give compliments to the chef for a job well done although my jeans would say otherwise lol. I had to be honest and rag on the silly salad. All and all a great experience, but don't take my word for it. After the movies hop right over to TGI Friday's and you be the judge.

On Veterans Day 2012, my dad, age 75, (a City of Bowie employee) wanted to go to TGI Fridays in Bowie for his "free" lunch that they were offering for Veterans.  So I picked up my dad at his house and off we went.  Unfortunately, it was very crowded with a 45 minute wait; so we went to the bar area and found 2 seats at the bar. It took the bartender 10 minutes to even look our way, it was like he was intentionally ignoring us.  He was busy, but not that busy as there was another helper.  So after 10 or so minutes he asked us for our drink order which we told him we were ready to order. My dad ordered the "steak skewers with vegetables" and I ordered the black bean burger with vegetables on the side (no fries).  After that, we sat there for about 35 minutes waiting and waiting for our food (the 2 ladies that came in after us go their food served before us).  Not once did the bartender (not so friendly guy with lots of tattoos on his arms and an attitude) ever check in with us or say anything to us at all. Finally about 45 minutes into sitting there the bartender brought over 2 plates of food.  One was a bacon cheeseburger with fries and the other was a blackbean burger with fries!!!  My father, who is a very gracious and kind person, told the bartender that wasn't what he ordered (not even close!), but that he would eat it.  Remember, he ordered steak and veggie skewers! My order was wrong too... I told the bartender that I ordered vegetables on the side (not fries), to which he replied they were out of "all" vegetables in the restaurant.  I told him I would like a side salad with blue cheese dressing then since they didn't have "vegetables".  He acted irritated with us.  I ate my black bean burger (it was okay, nothing great) and he never brought me my side salad and never acknowledged it again; nor did he check with us at all.  I had to ask him 3 times for ketchup for my father. It was hard to talk to him because it is so loud and noisy in there and he never looks in your direction or asks you how you are doing.  He was the most non-customer service, non-friendly, rude guy I ever encountered at a restaurant! Finally, I waved him down to get the check and he never gave me a "check", he simply says to me while standing in front of the cash register that the total is $18.  I paid the bill although I thought it was a little high for my dad having a "free" meal, but we did have 2 drinks (an iced tea and an O'Douls), so I just wanted to get out of there. As I paid the bill, the bartender took my iced tea away that I wasn't finished with so I asked him for a to go cup with a refill or a kids cup, to which he replied "we don't have to go cups". I find it hard to believe that a national chain restaurant doesn't have vegetables, to go cups and can't get orders straight!!!  Very unprofessional, disorganized, and a not very clean restaurant.   I will never eat there again!!!  It was a horrible experience. Spend your money somewhere else with a company that cares about their customers and hires friendly, professional, competent people. Normally, I would have gone right to the manager as all of these problems occurred, but my dad doesn't like confrontations or problems, so I bit my tongue and let it go.  However, I plan on calling the manager tomorrow to see what  he or she has to say. The worst $18 I ever spent!!!

I was a little skeptical about this place due to this spot making the evening news back in Aug of 2012 (google it!), but I was really hungry...so thought I'd try my luck. Came here on a Thursday night to somewhat of a club-scene in terms of the music and crowd at the bar. Very lively, happenin' place. I preferred to sit in the dining room where it was quiet and calm... although doing so forfeited my right to 1/2 off appetizers (they only give 1/2 off apps after 10pm for patrons who sit at the bar). But I instantly liked my server when I saw her (Jirae Foster), and so decided to pay essentially double for my meal simply to be waited on by her. The service was excellent. She was very attentive, smiled often (bearing an amazing braces-laden grin), charming and good looking. She was quick with my order, kept my drinks a'coming often, and generally seemed happy to be working. When I was indecisive about my order, she even suggested that I try something - and if I didn't like it to return it for something I did like. I'm not the kind to return food at a sit down restaurant (unless the food is horrible), but did appreciate her making the offer. Jirae delivered the kind of service that is unfortunately not typical of an urban TGI Fridays... so seeing her smile and being served by her was totally refreshing. The manager was also very active and visible during my visit (and actually was the one who brought me my food); so seeing him greeting people and actually working made me feel like the joint had made some positive changes to better ensure order in the restaurant on busy nights since its late summer "incident". I'm a local and will be back again!!

Horrible food and served lukewarm.... Don't let the commercials fool you, they got worse! It was the most awful and downright nasty food experience I have had in ages.  The server advised me two of three things I ordered were no go good to order which I could take as honesty but they did nothing well in the end. I attempted to order the Korean tacos and then a shrimp meal but in the end based on the server went with a cheeseburger... (can't go wrong with that --WRONG!) Okay the chili cheese queso dip was ok but warm at best --- the chips they served with were crystalized with salt. The potstickers were warm as well -- temperature issues!! They might have been decent had they not been sitting or eek warmed up properly!!! Okay my daughter got the chicken fingers and barely ate the fries and in a way I am thankful who knows what I was exposing her too if the chicken fingers were lukewarm as well. Cheeseburger was charcoaled and lukewarm with a hint of fishiness... wth! The brownie sundae was mush...  While I may give the chain a chance... I will not be giving this location a second chance.. cut my losses.
The service here is hit or miss. Some days the servers know what they're doing other days they don't have a clue.
I will say this. .. they got a remodel but they still have terrible roaches.... especially in the bar area.  It's best to go to Smokey bones next door. ..and you won't have to worry about being shot.

Yelp needs to allow no stars because this place would get it.  We walk in as a group of 5 and I already had a feeling that whoever the server was would feel overwhelmed and I was right!  The hostess seemed a little lost as to whose section to seat us she had to wait mother another hostess who was clearly annoyed to help her. The table we had was in clearly in the walkway of the servers, other patrons getting to table and the bathroom. I sat in that chair and constantly heard excuse me from and nothing but a hard get out the way bump on my chair. Our server "KJ" finally came to the table after us sitting for maybe 10 minutes at this point.  He was not knowledgeable about the drink menu, and food menu he actually got stuck in thought when we inquired about the ribs.  He wasn't attentive and his memory was no good we asked for water 3 times. His service was lack luster in my opinion and I work in the customer service field.  The overall experience wasn't good.

Sat at our table for fifteen minutes without being approached. The restaurant wasn't that busy and the wait staff was talking to one another. I love Fridays but I will never return to this one. This is by far the worst experience I've ever had at a Fridays. If I could give it quarter of a star...it would be appropriate.

The food is good but the atmosphere makes me feel like a gang war will break out at any time....with all the police etc; hanging out in the front working.  This is close to a movie theater and many young people here late at night.  The good thing is that they are open late but you may be too scared to eat here.

The waitress kept coming back every 5-7 minutes. It was very annoying. The bartender who was on that night was horrible. Drinks had seeds in them (some are supposed to, but these weren't). The pretzels were way too greasy. Didn't even order an entree. I will not be going back.
Service is ridiculous my appetizer came in way after my friends finished their entree. The service is terrible.
This is the WORST Friday's you can ever go to.  The food is average, bar isn't clean and the service is slow.  I rarely ever come here.  After hearing about the roaches. I'm not coming here again.

Horrible bar experience on a Friday night. Bartender spent more time complaining about being short on staff and service was extremely slow!!! I wanted to order food but changed my mind when I noticed how long a wait was for a refill!! Won't be going back!

After reading some of the reviews I was a little skeptical about going here but my party and I had a great time.  It's fridays not a 5 star joint the people there are awesome, the food was hot and fast and the drinks are fantastic if you want a fun place with a laid back fun atmosphere this is the place.  The kitchen was open late and $3 Long Islands you can't beat it I totally recommend this place especially if you are looking for some late night food and drinks.

Food is not that exciting, but service is excellent especially if Phillip,the head waiter, is the one taking care of you. I would only come back because of the service. The food was nothing a special not bad just meh!
Had a great time at the TGI Fridays in Bowie. David was our bartender and he made the night pleasurable. He was very attentive and a lot of fun. I will definitely be back!
We have had a horrible experiances at other local restaurants...... TGI Fridays changed our view on bowie restaurants.  The food was amazing and despite being busy our service was wonderful

UPDATE:******* Well, the thuggery is alive and well at this TGIFridays... All you here in this place is "Yo, yo, yo... What up son?"(Always said by white guys with fitted baseball caps on and a shirt that is 3 sizes too big for them).. Why did I even agree to meet a friend of mine there, anyway? What a shame this place is..

Horrible service this place needs better customer service. It took the waitress 20 minutes just to bring sliced lemons. Note to the waitress: don't use the excuse of I have another party cause you wouldn't like the excuse of "oh I'm not going to tip you".  If I could I wouldn't even rate this place with no star!

Terrible service! The table they seated us at was dirty and we had to ask another server to please it for us! My server didn't made several mistakes with myself and my dates food orders. She charge me more than what I paid for! I had a coupon for a free dessert or app and she ended up use it on my pick 3 app which I clearly told her I didn't want to use it on that I wanted to use it for a free dessert! I like Fridays but my experience there was highly disappointing! I will not be referring friends to go to that one in Bowie!

Never...Again... went w/a friend for saturday late lunch/early dinner. now, OK, maybe we're a pair of middle-aged women (i.e. not the clientele they cater to), but it took almost 20min for our server to come take our orders. he was very nice, but he also seemed to be the only staffer who was actually *working*. our food took forever to get to us. salmon was overcooked & just nasty. my steak - ordered mid-rare, was seriously overcooked AND cold. appetizers & sides? uck. again, maybe we were just too old. but the music was incredibly loud. i think TGIF's, at least the Bowie store, just wants to be a rowdy bar for the younger drinking crowd. so not impressed
This place is always so loud that you can't hold a conversation or enjoy your meal. The three times that I have been there, the women's bathroom is DISGUSTING.

Not too bad a place to eat on a Wednesday night.  It didn't start off too great, but it at least ended on a high note. The hostess wasn't very friendly, dressed sloppy and had a very "I just DGAF" attitude. The table she sat us at was disgusting. Visibly covered in some sort of liquid and when I tried to wipe it off, nasty, yellow, sticky stuff. Our waitress moved us. Our waitress was very friendly and exceptionally attentive. Though she did try to sell us on desserts like 2 minutes after being served dinner.  We ordered the Thai Tacos which were pretty good. Extremely tiny and there were only 3 on the plate which was ridiculous.  I had the baby back ribs with sweet potato fries and mashed potatoes, and I was in heaven. The ribs just fell apart and had a fantastic amount of sauce and the fries were crispy and delicious as was the mashed potatoes.  My boyfriend ordered the 10 oz. sirloin and ribs with sweet potato fries, he loved his food. He also had the peach crush drink thing. Jack with peaches. He loved it very much too, a nice change to his normal jack on the rocks. My biggest complaint with this place is that they had the temperature set to arctic chills. And did nothing to stop the families that had a bajillion kids from letting their kids run around screaming their faces off.

Came here with my friend Tiff and we ordered drinks, an appetizer and dinner. The server's name was Elizabeth and was very friendly! She had a smile on her face and was very kind when we kept taking forever to make up our minds on what to order. Server wise she was perfect! Drink wise...great! I had a blue hawaiian and Tiff had a fiery apple because they were $5 and she was drooling about it all day. Appetizer wise we ordered spinach and artichoke dip. Would've been great except the chips were stale. Ugh..such a disappointment. Problem is we were so hungry that we ate them anyway!  For dinner I had a Cesar salad and sizzling chicken. The salad didn't have enough dressing, it was like a walk in the desert looking for water. Or Christopher Columbus looking for land! The lettuce was crisp though which was a plus.  The chicken was overcooked and very dry. The cheese helped to not make the chicken taste so bad and the mashed potatoes were great! Then again this is a chain and they aren't always the best places to except great quality food.  Thank goodness our server was great otherwise I would've gave this place 1 star. Inner fat kid says: Drink with a friend...because friends don't let friends eat stale chips alone!
The service started out OK and went downhill from there. Sometimes I don't know why I continue to patronize this location.

I've never been a big TGI Friday's person, but I was out voted on where to go and we ended up here. Our server was M.I.A for the first 10 minutes after we were seated. She finally came over and was very apologetic. It wasn't a busy night, but it just seemed that the service was a bit slow.  I decided on the Jack Daniel's chicken (you can never go wrong when Jack is involved) so that was pretty good.  For my 2 sides I had the mashed potatoes which weren't impressive and the tomato mozzarella salad which was just okay.  I can see that they've changed their menu up a bit and the prices have gone up since the last time I've been here.   The bathrooms were kept clean and neat and once our server became visible, she was rather attentive.  The noise in the bar area was pretty loud and a little disturbing at times.  It was just a mediocre experience. Can't say that I would return anytime soon, but it is an option for a quick bite.

Food was fine but when a friend and I checked our bank statement (seperate checks) we saw that the waitress, Ebony, added an addtional $14 to her tip after we left. We drove back the next day and told the manager and he said he just fired another waitress for the same thing. The manager fixed the problem but never gave us any coupons or anything to compensate for our trouble. If you go here do not pay with a card! The saddest part is that we're in the army and were in uniform at the time.

Can't review the food...restaurant was so loud and the service so bad, we never even ordered a meal. We were seated next to a television with the volume turned all the way up.  It was so loud we couldn't hear each other, and we asked to be moved.  The hostess did move us (after giving us some attitude) and then we sat.  After fifteen minutes of no contact of any kind from the wait staff, we left.

The service was beyond poor.  There was no one to greet us. We waited 10 minutes to even see a hostess.  Then our drinks came 10 minutes after we completed our meal. when we simply ask for the bill, that literally took 25 minutes. I had to get up and ask the manager for the bill. I go to restaurants twice a week every week, but this was the worst experience ever.

My family and I went to TGI Fridays for lunch. There were flies everywhere the service was horrible, greasy floor, just overall disgusting! We were in a bit of a rush and to make matters worse we put our order in when we arrived. All of our food arrived except for my mothers. We told the waitess and she forgot to out in her order and it wasnt even busy that day. So my mom had to wait another 30 minutes for her food and the waitress didnt even suggest to have her meal comped. I had to ask her. The poor people next to us got their drinks spilled on them by the same waitress. What a horrible restraunt. never again. Also i hear someone was killed there recently over a fight. Stay away!

Don't waste your time on this place.  Throughout our visit we had three different waitresses, the first one took our drink order, but didn't return again.  The next person brought our drinks and didn't return again.  The third waitress who never introduced herself asked what appetizer we wanted, assuming we wanted one, she was not friendly the entire evening.  Food was delivered after a very long wait, partially incorrect.  No refills on water, didn't see much of our waitress after the food was delivered.  Very poor service and the place wasn't busy which should have been our first clue.  We will not be returning to this location again.

Server was good, and food was better! I ordered a peach mango lemonade, and the jack Daniel platter which had 1/2 rack ribs/ fried shrimp/ and chicken tenders....it was worth the $$$ and I ate everything. The server we had was attentive and we had a party of five. She had refills ready too!  Food came in a reasonable time it was pretty steady. I would definitely go back
Visiting for the night -- very slow service, their frozen food is better than what they served tonight.

Worstttttt!!! Took 20 mins to get a seat. 30min to get someone to even ask for our drinks. Never came back with our drinks. Manager finally came and offered a FREE APPETIZER.  After that food finally came. And WE LEFT. I will not be returning to this location.

Stopped here because I was starving and it was close to the hotel. Exterior:  this location is located in a shared parking lot with a couple of restaurants and a movie theater just behind.  The entrance is not off the primary road, so you might have to use GPS to find it.  The exterior grounds were clean and presentable. Interior:  the interior was overall clean.  As I was waiting to be seated, I noticed a number of tables that had not been bussed yet.  The main seating area appears to be on the right side of the restaurant, with a bar area to the left of the main entrance.  I saw additional seating further to the right, past the bar area. Staff:  this is the reason for so few stars.  My waiter was perfect.  Professional, attentive, polite, and personable are all words to describe him.  The rest of the staff definitely were less so.  The waitress stand was unoccupied when I went in and continued to remain unoccupied during my entire visit.  I observed numerous couples/groups come in and stand for up to 5 minutes waiting to be addressed.  Staff would simply walk past them on the way to or from their tables.  One waitress did take care of a couple and walked to the back to yell that they needed help out front.  However, no one took up the challenge of coming up front.  The couple she seated waited roughly 10 minutes before anyone came to their table.  I was in a position to hear there was not an assigned staff member for that area and the couple shouldn't have been seated there.  I observed many of the tables around me being ignored or not getting a staff member to come but every once in a great while (after their glasses were completely empty).  I couldn't identify whom the manager was (or if there was one), but having a manager visible and directing the activity would have been beneficial. Food:  I ordered the Jack Daniels ribeye, mac & cheese, and tomato mozzarella salad.  The ribeye was cold when I received it, but the mac & cheese was perfect.  The salad was also just the way I like it.  I was starved, so I didn't care if the ribeye was cold...it was cooked perfectly at least. Overall, if you find yourself starved and want immediate assistance, this is not the place to dine.  There are many other restaurants extremely close to this location.

Friday's in Bowie Town Center... I have been to many restaurants and even worked in food and beverage services my own self. This establishment is by far the worst experience I've seen with my own eyes. Management is absolutely horrible when it comes down to taking care of their guest.  We ordered a blue motorcycle and it was very clear to everyone's eyes that it was watered down. We asked for a manager, and the MOD, Jerry was VERY unprofessional in approaching us about the issue. "Whether you drink it or not, it'll still be on your bill." I'm sorry that we advised you about your drink that was made very poorly. We bring money to your establishment and this is how you treat your guests??  Thank you Kadija for taking care of the issue after how far it escalated, but if Jerry can do that to one guest, I can only imagine how many more are exposed to this horrible attitude of his.  Yes, one customers voice might not matter too much to your establishment, but I  AS WELL AS FRIENDS AND FAMILY WILL NEVER return to this establishment EVER AGAIN. #fridays #bowietowncenter #horriblemanagement #terribleservice

We came in for a quick lunch and found out they were short of servers and had the Host waiting tables. He tried his best, but wasn't trained on the menu or order system so our food was warm and our bill had to be changed.  When we tried to get the one server that was working to help get us our bill, she coped an attitude. Understand they are short staffed but making sure customers are happy is the key.

First let me preface by saying I uae to work at the largest Olive Garden in the U.S. in San Diego, we were a well oiled machine with overall good management  (we didn't always like them, but we as a team got the job done) Ok let's just jump into the bad & ugly first: 1. They do not take reservations for large parties 2. They seat extremely large parties before less than half of their party arrives 3. We needed an area for a party of 12, we were originally given 3 separate tables that were way too far apart 4. They kept talking about they just seated a party of 26...this was some freaking teenagers that was less our party of 12 (like WTF???) 5. Service was slow, even to get our children drinks, appetizers, or food so my son was screaming out the entire night until he had his food. (I'm actually still mad about this right now at 6:18am...I may call you alls Regional Manager about this) *Educational Tip: When a family comes in immediately ask what the parents would like for the child to eat & drink, parents can starve to death but absolutely get pissed if our child is hungry. We also barley get to eat so putting in the child's order first when appetizers would normally go in for the entire table allows the parents to feed the child first then enjoy their own meal when their food comes around.* 6. Under staffed on a Friday night...at T.G.I. Fridays??? This was the part that didn't make any sense & resulted in a domino effect on our entire evening. Management...it's the second day of spring,  use your brains... 7. "We don't have any Kid's Menus (obviously no crayons as well)...I blame management for this is well because most of your staff doesn't even know the Kid's Menu by heart...I'm irritated again. The good: 1. The food was on point & the drinks were great (alcoholic & non-alcoholic) 2. The place was very clean 3. Eric & a pregnant female server were very friendly If the management at this location was better then they could be as good as the Fridays in District Heights or The Boulevard because the servers would be set up for success. There was a lot of money in our party & you could have easily gotten a tip of almost if not $40+ but you focused on a table that was supposed to be 26 teenagers & their party was smaller than ours...smh

The only reason this place is getting 2 stars from me is because of our waitress Daniel. Other than that just like every other Friday's they didn't have something, this time no Top Shelf liquor at all! How do you have a franchise restaurant with out that? Daniel made our dinner pleasant tho.

My advice to Management -- fire the staff and start from scratch.  I mean it, the whole lot of them.   I've never even *heard* of service this bad.  While I waited 30 minutes just for someone to say hi (AFTER being seated), the employees were literally eating plates of food in plain view of the customers!  My fiance and I left in disgust and walked over to Longhorn.  We, as residents, need to stop settling for poor service or establishments such as this one will continue to hire employees who dont take pride in their work and don't know the meaning of customer service.   I gave them one star for somehow managing to stay in business this long in spite their staff.  Stay away from this place.

This is the worse Fridays I've experienced.  I should have known when I sat down and the lady next to me had to talk to the manager about her food.  I ordered a turkey burger with bacon.  They have me one piece broken in half.  I asked for more since I am paying for it.  They sent it cold bacon. It still had harden grease on it. Drinks are horrible too.  Just all around bad.  0 stars.

The pregnant bartender is the absolute worst!!!  I get being pregnant and cranky, but she should save that mess for home not work. In addition to the constant complaining about "needing to take maternity leave ASAP" she walked away while I was giving my order, I'm talking mid sentence forgot what I was saying when she came back!! So unprofessional! No greeting when we sat at the bar, just sat menus down and walked away and didn't address us until about 10 mins later when we called her over to place our orders, No drinks, no offer for appetizers. It was like we were invisible.
Usually go here on the regular and never had any issues. Went today and after finishing my food saw a roach climb onto the bar. Smh. Never again

We arrived around 6:30 PM on a Wednrsday nite. Restaurant had a light crowd, was quiet. Our server was T'Roya. She was quick to our table once seated, but then we waited a while until she came back for our order. We ordered the grilled 10 oz top sirloin steak and ribs and a Jack Daniels 10 oz ribeye steak with crispy shrimp. The menu said the ribeye was "generously marbled" to be tender, but it was actually a little too fatty. It was as promised, so didn't complain. The fries w/ the top sirloin were soggy. Sides in general less generous than we expected. Glad we had a BOGO to compensate for generally slow but friendly service and so so exciting food in a less than busy environment. Don't expect to return to this location since we have better satisfaction at other TGIFs.

So I'm giving this review three stars ONLY because of the To-Go Servee Joshua (I believe that's his name). I went to the to-go area and saw a gathering of the restaurant employees all chatting about different things. I figured if someone saw me standing there they would stop the conversation and assist. This did not happen. A young lady with blue locs asked Josh if he was doing to-go and he got up to answer a question over the phone. He proceeded to take 3 more calls and immediately walked back to his co-workers after finishing the 3rd call. I was upset by this point so I started looking around for anyone to assist me. One of his co-workers mentioned I was waiting and he came up to greet me. I expressed my dissatisfaction for waiting but he remained calm and we ended up making light of the situation. He brought out my food and I believe it was MUCH more than I was supposed to receive. I appreciate this young man for remaining calm and not throwing an attitude at me because I expressed my dissatisfaction. And he did what he could to rectify my wait time. I think management should keep in mind how it looks as a waiting patron with 5-6 employees standing around conversing with each other. Josh is on the right track!

Only go here if you like eating reheated food. I ordered a full rack of ribs and got two reheated half racks and rancid coleslaw. This is the worst Friday's I've been to and I'm a big fan of Friday's.

horrible place. i will never go here again. the staff isn't that welcoming. I was seated and not attended to for 15 mins..after placing my order..the waitress brought my main course and forgot my appetizer. Prior to ordering, i told the waitress that i have a coupon...i was told it is okay and can be used when she gives me the check. Once i gave her the coupon towards the end..she comes back to tell me that the manager said only TGIF "franchise" will accept this coupon and that they are "CORPORATE". It was the most horrible experience ever. they do not live up to their word! will not recommend this place to anyone else ever again. i finally ended up giving the waitress a "free appetizer or dessert" coupon. she then tells me, "oh this can work..i think". not a place go to if you want to be served on time!!!

No service. No one to seat you. No one the wait you. No one cares if you come there or not. After 5 minutes someone from the kitchen seated us. 5 minutes later no one had come to the table to bring water or introduce themselves. Hate to imagine the food service if I stayed to order. Plenty of people working but... no service

It's Thursday night I decided to go to Friday's for spinach dip. They have none so I had to order something else since I was there for a meeting and was starving. A manager never came over to apologize on behave of the product not being in demand. I don't think I'll be back to this Friday's

Couldn't give them half a star, which is more than they deserve. Got seated, it took a waiter 10 minutes to take our drink orders. 20 minutes after talking our food order, the waiter told us that bad news: no French dip sandwiches and no French onion soup. Really, 20 minutes to tell us that? Food for 12 came out in 4 groups about 5 minutes apart. One dinner didn't show up, so we got it to go. Not too sure where the problem is. My guess it the general manager has no clue about running a restaurant, less about managing people, and has absolutely no idea what customer service is. Two and a half hours for a simple dinner that wasn't anything special. Best thing corporate could do would be to hang a for sale sign on the place. No, we won't be back!

I would love to describe to food... Buuut the waiter/waitress never came. I waited 5 minutes to be seated... No hostess... I waited 10 minutes at a booth... Guess what??? No waiter/waitress... So I walked out. Fix yourself.

Went on a sat. I use to go to this Friday's for lunch everyday this place has gotten quit dirty. Our serve was very good and very attentive the table floor and utensils we very dirty wife's water glass had lip stick on it. The chix fingers and fries were very good as always wife had the grilled chix and it was good also

My squad and I were craving Jerrys but they were jam packed! So we walked over to TGIF. The hostess was nice and we sat at the bar to watch the Wizards game. Alex our bartender she was nice and took our drink order fast. I ordered light. Jack sliders, my strawberry daq and Tennessee whiskey cake. My friends ordered wings, pretzel bites and some drinks. All were happy with their order and said they would come back. The sliders were good a little dry maybe because I had it well done. Strawberry Daq was very good and not weak as some Friday's like to water it down. I saved the best for last! Tennessee whiskey cake! It's da bomb!  Spice cake served warm and moist and tasty with caramel drizzled on top and whip cream with vanilla ice cream on the side. My new favorite! They have an option if you want baileys Irish cream. I'll try that next time. As for service it was good under the circumstances. I think management needs to have more servers or bartenders on the weekends. How do you have one person working the bar on a busy Saturday night?!Alex was the only one working and was making sure everyone at the bar was taken care of. I read the reviews prior to coming here and took a chance. Glad I did. I found a new chill spot and made new friends as well. Too bad the Wizards lost.
Well that was lousy service... server that didn't seem to care about me, a single diner. Very inattentive. Food was so-so... and apparently kitchen can't serve a side of lettuce....
My boyfriend just had a horrible food poisoning(vomiting and diarhia) shortly after eating here. He had a butter shrimp and a burger.

My sisters and I ate at this location in Feb 2016, paid with 3 different cards, a week later all of our bank accounts were hacked. I called and spoke with the manager Mr.Williams, he could care less about what happened. I filed a police report. The staff has a card scam going on. In addition to that I just went back with a different group 3/19/19 (I did not want to but the group did so I brought cash this time) This time it was a female manager, not professional at all. She said she could not seat us bc they only had 2 servers. 2 servers on a Saturday night??  I have never been refused service at a restaurant...we left and went next door to Smokey Bones. Every single time I visit this location there is a issue. From the moment you walk in the door. The hostess was not friendly either. I love their food, but I am done with this location!

We had a party of around 25 for a paint and sip event that was held at this location. Service was disorganized and slow.  They need to figure out a better method to getting orders and food out... I was there for over an HOUR before my drink came out... which was only a COKE! I was there for an hour and 20 mins when my appetizer finally arrived.  Not very happy with the service.

Server was OK but very stand offish and you could see her thong was pulled up farther than her jeans. Music was loud so you could not really carry on a conversation. Very  impersonal will not be returning.

OK. So me the wife came back to this place primarily because Fridays sent us some coupons that were pretty sweet. 20% off the entire check or one entree free.  We keep running into the same issue. Slow, Slow, Slow.  this time we were seated pretty quickly and the waiter even came around pretty quickly but you could tell he wasn't overly enthused about the j-o-b. We ordered drinks (a marguerita for the Missus and a smoothie for me).  It took forever.  The main food took awhile as well. I ordered my Jack Daniels steak medium which they cooked to almost completely well but it did have the ever so slightest hint of pink so maybe it was medium well. The dessert was good but it involved a heated Tennessee Whiskey cake and a scoop of ice cream so the heated cake had all but melted the ice cream by the time it got to out table. Here's the deal. I've been to this Fridays about four times because it's close to my home, because it's close to the theater, because they send coupons but if I were upper management at Fridays I would seriously be looking at closing this place down.  The only thing I can think is that it does a hell of a bar business or goes crazy busy at night.

WORST SERVICE EVER! Server was rude, food took over 20 mins to arrive, all of my food was cold! The manager was rude and did not accommodate me at all. I am pissed and will never return to this GOD awful establishment!
Came into the restaurant on a Saturday during the summer. Service was delayed and the seating was filthy. They failed to clean the area and there were many fruit flies. Food was mediocre.

The seat was nasty with food stains that wasn't wiped off and the floor was wet with juice spills.  Therefore, I decided to leave. If an establishment can't keep the dinning area clean, I can only imagine what the kitchen looks like.. Unsanitized!

This is the worst Friday's I've been too in quite sometime. We ordered tea, coffee, and a Tennessee Whiskey Cake. The waitress bought us a cold drink out, no spoons for our coffee,  tea, and cake her response was "we don't have any clean spoons". Hmm! Check please  P.S. Dirty restrooms as well...

Normally I enjoy coming here after work just to wind down. But lately it's been sub par because of one particular bartender. She can be quite annoying and when I voiced my complaint to her. She said "there are about 100 Fridays in the area, you can go somewhere else. We won't miss you". Really Fridays??  Don't deal with Ebony. She may come off sweet, but she has a real nasty side.

The review says 1 star but I really wish you had the option for 0. This establishment is so bad that I actually downloaded the Yelp app filled out the membership forum just to tear this place a new one. I have come here 4 different times just because it is close to my hotel. Each time I've come here my friend's drinks have been terrible... They taste like soap we ask for small plates they say they don't have a dishwasher on duty, I ordered a 2 beers at different times, and both times it took over a half hour to come I had a Budweiser and a Heineken. It's as simple as going to the back and getting a bottle or pulling on the tap handle. I will say this there is no problem in the food department the food is great 100% delicious but the service is god awful my food came out wrong two of the times I went there. And I cannot lie about this two hostesses locked my lady friend in the bathroom on the 13th because she was talking to one of their boyfriends. I am flabbergasted at the lack of professionalism in this establishment I am Livid shame on you TGI Fridays for charging people for this type of service. I suggest you take care of this issue by doing some type of undercover boss thing wear a wig into the place and look at how the staff carry themselves it is obnoxious
Please do yourself a favor do . Our server was so bad . Wait at the door for 10 minutes then we get seated waited for 20 minutes . The place is filthy
Two stars because our server was great and the drinks were ok. Food could have been better. Fridays used to be really nice, but know it's subpar in my book.

HORRIBLE PLACE EVER! We just left here(8/28/16)Sunday.we came out for my niece's birthday...this happens to be her favorite restaurant(not this one in particular) point blank if you're not black you will not get good service at all! We were a party of 14 and I'm putting a number so the ignorant employees there understand when they read this,we were seated and left there   water at the table,no silverware,no care in the world and mind you there were 4 servers posted at eye view and not once did they approach.I went to the front to see what was going on and all I got was that someone would be with us.Again nothing! So after another 15,20 min we decided to leave,the only courteous thing that came out of this was the host came to hold the door for us instead of asking what   again if you're Latino PLEASE stay away! Don't ruin your evening here!....It sucks when the race that complains about discrimination doesn't do anything to change things.

The food is great but the service is a little slow due to the high volume of people they are always getting.  Im glad they brought back endless appetizers because its a good way to sit back with a friend and eat and socialize.  The bartender made the drinks just right.  This tgif is in a college town so if you dont like crowded areas or it being loud I would not go to this one.

Let's see... It took my server 15 minutes to ask me if I wanted something to drink and my food was delivered without any silverware. Honest mistake I guess... But I had to track him down to ask for silverware, then he took his time and made me wait 10 minutes before he came back to my table with the freaking silverware! Server 101 if you ask me... Ordered a Togo container and ate my food at home, which wasn't even all that good. My opinion-don't waste your time or money on this ghetto ass place.

I did not have a good experience here. I ordered food to go online. My confirmation said my order should have been ready at 8:48 pm. I arrived at 8:50 pm purposely to give a little extra time for it to be ready. When I arrived I was shown where to go to pick up my order. I have them my name and the girl said ok and went in the back... she never came back out. No one came back out to say anything about what was going on with the order or anything. I stood there for another 30 mins until who I'm guessing was a manager came out and asked what I had ordered and then he proceeded to get my order. Needless to say I won't be going back to this location. Poor customer service!

Food was not good. I ordered wings and they were terrible!!! How can you mess up wings!! Anyhow the the wings were old and overly fried (too hard)!!!! The sauce was gooey...like they just poured the sauce on before it was given to me...oh well!! Never going to this one again for the wings...the service was ok. No complaints in that department. Next time I'm going to smokey bones!!! ;)

The hostess told us a 10 min wait, but then sat a couple that came in after us before they sat us. Once seated we waited 15 min before a server came up to us to tell us they are currently short staffed and that there are only 2 chefs preparing food on a Saturday night!! There wasn't any silverware at our table so I had to ask the server to bring us silverware which didn't happen so my boyfriend had to take it from an empty table. We ordered two Jack Daniel's and Coke for a drink and he came back with two cokes only. I explained that we ordered a jack and coke and he looked confused about what I was asking. As my meal I ordered the pick 3 appetizers with boneless buffalo wings, mozzarella sticks and loaded potato skins. They came out with Jack Daniels boneless wings (I assume that's what happened to the jack daniels that was supposed to be in my drink), mozzarella sticks and pot stickers! The fuck ups were endless!!! I will not be coming back here EVER!!! If I could select 0 stars that would be a more accurate rating for my experience

This place is terrible service..The staff must make very good hourly to not provide any service.. You have to blame the no good management here..  NEVER AGAIN  I will go to Laurel when I want to do TGIF

The usual meeting spot for friends and I after work. We've had a terrible service three consecutive times due to the lack of communication and long unnecessary wait times. You think why go back three times in a row if the service is terrible? See...this is the middle location since my friends and I do not live in the same area. Long story short. I will now vent.   During the third visit, my friend and I literally stood in the front of the restaurant, that if I may mention, had no hostess or any employee that would care enough to stop to see if we needed help, if we were lost or anything. Annoying and unacceptable. We were finally greeted after 10 minutes, and taken our table.  We were reluctant about the area we were sitting in because we noticed that it was the same area of the waiter that we had before and ironically servicing that section. However, we still decided to stay and give it another chance. We realized that we gave him too much benefit of the doubt as we waited entirely too long for our drinks and soon learned that our food orders never was entered in the system....AGAIN! Like wtf?  Yes, everybody makes mistakes but it's all about COMMUNICATION! If we were told sooner or later about what happened, we wouldn't have been as upset as we were. Our waiter, Adam, seemed to over-compensate for his continuous mistakes and his lack of attentiveness with unwarranted humor that got old very quickly. Needless to say, the manager gave us 20% off of our checks and we ended up getting what we needed in a timely manner thanks to our new best waitress, Lexie. Since this location is our meeting spot, we will ask for her from now on!  Food and drinks were good, however, this location is in dire need of stronger management and attentive employees.
Very bad service!!! A poor experience.  No body take care of our party.  If you entered, run away!!!

This is the worst representation of the TGIF restaurant name. It's Saturday at 2pm and they are understaffed. The host are untrained and the  manager is non-existent. DO NOT frequent this location. HORRIBLE HORRIBLE experience. I couldn't rate food cause after 20 minutes of waiting they told us it would be another 30 min before we were sat. Needless to say we left.

I don't expect much at franchise restaurants, but I do expect to be acknowledged and served. Tonight was my 1st visit to this restaurant in 2017 and will most likely be my last. The customer service was not great, not poor, it was non-existent. Staff was more concerned about what they didn't have or what cleanup they needed to do to close the restaurant (closes at 2am, I'm there at 10pm) , then they were about the customers. I stood in the doorway for nearly 20 minutes without being acknowledged (yes. I have used a stopwatch). The entire time, staff is walking around or looking at me from the floor, bar, and kitchen, with no thought about seating me or the other couple beside me.  At this point, two ladies leave the bar, opening up some seats. I seat myself and it's another 3 minutes to get a drink. This wasn't the bad part though. After getting the drink, I was ignored for asking for a menu. Mind you, I just got off work and haven't eaten all day, so I'm quite hungry and cash is burning a hole in my pocket if I can just order some food, there is a guarantees $50 tip. Unfortunately, no food was able to be ordered cause the menu never came. At this point I asked for the Receipt  only to be forgotten. Finally get the needed attention and she won't even print the check, instead yelling the balance across the bar. I was tempted to just walk out, but there are Police stationed in the restaurant. Not dining, no stationed. Terrible experience if you can call it that. Paid my tab and left to go get something from a drive through.  At least Wendy's can get my order and deliver me food in under 30minutes. Come on guys, get it together. I work across the street, bartended for years and still work in customer service. Never been this disappointed.

The worst Fridays I've ever been to, hands down. We had been here 2 other times and it was mediocre at best. Tonight we had a gift card so headed here because it's the closest location to us.  We ordered wings, I ordered a salad and hubby ordered a sandwich. Wings were okay, nothing special. They looked like they had been under the heat lamp for 10 minutes though. Both my salad and hubby's sandwich were missing multiple ingredients that were listed on the menu. My salad was missing avocado, tortilla strips, and cilantro. His sandwich was missing onion straws and pickles, and the lettuce on his sandwich was not appetizing. Our food was brought out by a food runner and not our waiter. Our waiter didn't come over to our table for nearly 10 minutes after our food arrived. When we told him our entrees were missing ingredients, he said, "oh, I didn't bring out the food."  No apology or offer to fix it. I had already started eating my salad so asked him to at least bring the avocado out. It never came. Hubby's sandwich was now cold and it just didn't look that good, so he asked for another order of wings. They took forever to come out but looked much better than our original order. At this point we had already been at the restaurant for nearly an hour and a half so we just wanted to get the check and leave. To top it all off I had to ask twice for a glass of water and my husband never got his water which he ordered. We asked to speak to a manager and she did say they were having problems with the kitchen and she comped some of our food. I understand sometimes places have off nights but the first two times we had been here we weren't impressed either. (But we just had drinks and appetizers the other times which were better.)  Oh, and the bathrooms were filthy, and the silverware was wrapped in a dirty napkin. We won't be back.

I purchased a Groupon and made a reservation on open table. When I arrived tonight, I was told by the hostess that she was told not to take reservations and that we had to wait 30 minutes. I canceled my Groupon and left. Hard to support local businesses who practice like this. Will not return.  2/18/17 @ 7:15 PM.

This place is TERRIBLE!!! I come here because my son and I love their jack daniels selections but after last night, never again!!!! To start, only a quarter of the restaurant is full but the wait it always at least 15 minutes because they don't want to give the servers more than 3 tables. Here's a suggestion, hire more staff!! After getting out dinnerware, I unrolled the napkin to find dried up food/barbecue sauce on it....yuck. Once the server came, the first thing she said to us was 'I don't know why they say y'all here, we don't have enough servers so bare with me or I'll have to ask the manager to assist' THAT was strike two but being greedy, we stayed. Tried ordering some wings only to be told that they were out of four of the seven sauces including barbecue......whaaaaa? Nothing more to say, just look at the pics and decide to dine elsewhere

If I could give no stars , I would .... Horrible service . I only went here because I got the Groupon and didn't see it said Bowie . My server was Chuck . When we first got seated I saw him serving a table and apologizing because the wife's didn't come out with the husbands . He then went over to his phone for a few minutes before even heading my way . It was very short didn't explain the menu or anything . I was disappointed that I ordered the cotton candy drink and didn't get the full experience. We ordered endless apps but that never came true because he never came back and when he did . We asked him for another order , which never came out . After waiting I asked for the bills . He said because we had endless apps that I couldn't use my Groupon . We never got another serving of the app so I was confused . I went to the mgr . She was brown with dreds. The first thing she did was walk away from me . I wouldn't have walked out upset if only she apologized for a mess of a shift that she was running . After going back and forth with chuck and his mgr , I was able to use my Groupon and leave . I have 3babies , so waiting around didn't work for me . He didn't refill their drinks when asked , she we left and went somewhere else .  Please avoid this location at all cost .

Stay the hell away from this location. The bartender had a bad attitude and was inattentive. I didn't get her name. My friends food was served cold and the drinks were watered down. This was a first, I've never had an issue in the past & perhaps it was a bad night but I won't be back. Glad our food was FREE!
I was just there last nite and I seen two roaches.... all the manager did was offer more food.... why would I eat food from a place i just seen roaches roam... it's prolly roach eggs in the food.....

Came to Friday's to check out the all you can eat appetizers, my best advice is "Don't do that". The appetizers are very limited and u have to pick just one and finish it before getting another one. If you feel like having some cheese stick figure on eating a plate of them before having some bufallo bites. But put the major flaw of the ordering system aside and the next problem is the service is pitiful. It takes forever to get an appetizer refilled so this adventure should b planned as an afternoon event. The servers are slow to get u ur order but, dont worry they appearently don't mind serving double helpings of bad attitude, oh yeah, n don't expect to be able to wash is down w/ ur beverage bc they don't refill those either. If u decide to give it a try, I wish u the best of luck

My experience was bad ! Tuesday evening and the service is poor!!!! I ordered an appetizer and it took 25 minutes!!!!! Then it came out to the wrong thing! So I had to wait another 30 minutes !!!! DONT COME HERE !!!

This restaurant is infested with roaches.  Today I had a roach crawl out of my plate and onto the bar top.  My meal was taken off of my check but I was given a check for my drink.  The manager obviously knew what had occurred because he came over and stood near me but he never approached me.  I am disgusted!  I was a regular at this place but from now on I will be taking my business elsewhere.

Would give this place zeros stars if I could. They told my party that their servers were about to go home at 9pm and could not accommodate us. They also suggested that we go to Smokey Bones, a near by restaurant. Absolutely terrible customer service. I suggest not going here and maybe checking Smokey Bones instead.

The worst TGI Friday's I have eaten in.  Went there after a movie on a Friday afternoon.  Waited 30 mins to be seated.  Waited 20 more mins before waiter came to get order.  Ordered a medium rare burger.  While waiting for food another 20 mins, looked over at table across from us where a family was eating and saw a burger that had been sitting at the table for 20 mins that looked like the burger I had ordered.  When we finally got the waiters attention. He said, it was my burger, and tried to serve me the cold well done dry burger.  I told the manager what had happened and just wanted my bill for the coke that was ordered because we could never get the waiters attention  to give us the bill.  The manager Informed me to not leave, that he would give me another fresh burger at no cost.  Unbelievable, I received the same cold hard well done burger that was given to me the first time.  I decided this place was a waste of my time and will not be back!!

Don't really know where to start... The place SERIOUSLY needs a face lift because it's dark and has outdated seating and tables. We went in on a Wednesday night to catch the Wizards and Caps playoff games. little did we know, neither game was being offered when we got there. The service was terrible, slow, and unapologetic! The drinks were not good either. I would give the food a C- but then again, I hadn't eaten all day before going so it may have been closer to a D-. This particular Fridays used to be packed with customers. And they used to serve decent drinks and great food. I will NEVER return there again and I live less than 5 miles away.

I will never again spend my money in this establishment. My husband and I ordered 2 drinks, which were terrible. He ordered wings, I ordered a hamburger. His food came out in 5 minutes, my burger never came out. This is the second time I've gone to this Friday's, there won't be a third.

Im being nice by giving a 3rd star me and my bf use to come here all the time ...... i mean its a chain i have to say it but these days you dont walk into a chain being wowed by the food unless its cheesecake factory ir a brio but fridays usually always has decent food ....so thts while ill give it extra points .. where this fridays fell off for me is their drinks.. yes i get it the house margarita and house long island are deals and cheap in price but it does not mean it needs ro be cheap in qualoty .. when i get a long island i expect to taste like their is some alcohol in their i mean come on its a long island. Their house drinks use to be good as their non special drinks back in the day but now their long island legit just taste like tea  lol i ended up getting the ultimate one next which was a little better but my bf politely asked is there anyway i can get this a little stronger instead of the bartender saying sure thing she said well i mean its a long island  its one of tye strongest drinks you can have. Its like well clearly his isnt ifnhe is asking about it ... i just thought that was kind of rude

I am a happy hour girl, I like to get started early. I knew I would be in Bowie again after Smokey Bones dropped the ball last week I wanted to see if anything was better. I called to ask what the happy hour specials were to avoid looking at an old menu online. A girl answered the phone and said that there was $5 Patron margaritas. When we arrived to the happy hour it was empty and there wasn't $5 Patron magaritas. The manager was at the bar and I explained to her that I called (showed her my call log)and told her what I was told. She basically said she doesn't care what the Friday's employee told me that she wasn't going to manage the situation. Basically she said F us. This is the 2nd Bowie restaurant in a week to give this town a bad name.

I'm not one to EVER ask for much at restaurants but  the service was terrible. My family of 4 got the endless apps. The server barely checked up on us. Our total time there was about 2.5 hours and we were only served like 5 apps. We were all irritated and although she apologized, this isn't the first time this has happened at this location. It wasn't even that busy.

Yo this place is crazy.  We sat at the bar just as two female bartenders were verbally fighting and was about to erupt into fisticuffs.  Wild. Free entertainment I guess.  Food was regular Friday fare.  Came out hot.  Got the unlimited apps. Service was on the slow side but acceptable.  One star cause that's not what I want after I get out of work....high level drama with adults threatening each other 15 inches from my face.  Manager did finally come out after several employees broke it up.  No offers or discounts given....no apologies given either......this was several weeks ago.

One of the worst restaurants I've ever been to.  I was not acknowledged or served after 30 minutes of sitting in a restaurant that was maybe at 35% of its capacity.  Worst of all, when I complained to the manager prior to departing, he just nodded his head and never apologized.    Don't go here unless you want poor service and lackadaisical attitudes about everything.

Unfortunately, this was my worst Fridays experience....EVER! I agree with a previous post that "If I could give no stars, I would..." My boyfriend and I stopped by for some appetizers and a drink. We sat at the bar for 15 minutes before we were welcomed or asked if we wanted to order anything. He ordered the endless apps which wound up being pointless because the apps hardly came out. We weren't really attended to for the time that we were there.  I had an issue with my order where the food came out and it was really cold as if it may have just been sitting in the kitchen. I spoke to the manager about it who seemed to have an issue with me bringing up a problem. Most restaurant managers would apologize and try to make the customer happy, this manager just walked away.  I have been to plenty of Fridays and despite how crowded the restaurant may have been my food was always hot, came out on time and my server or bartender was attentive. I will not be giving this Fridays another try.

We came here to get some drinks and a light dinner. The food (fried shrimp, and bourbon chicken with fries) was delicious. I'm giving them three stars because our drinks came after our dinner was served. I've never had that happen. We ordered the Frozen Lava Flow.  It came late, was very weak, and the drink looked nothing like the picture. They didn't put the  in the drink. It was horrible. It was like drinking a weak non alcoholic smoothie.  Our server was ok. We she handed us the check, it came without the folder. Maybe I'm just old school and expecting good service is a thing of the past. Sad.

Can I please give this place no stars???? The service sucks. We came in got seated right away...I thought this was a good sign but no it wasn't. It took our server about 20 mins to come to us. They didn't have one of the appetizers we ordered...ok no problem order something else....nope that came out wrong. Drinks came late and then not at all. Entree was cold. Thanks but no thanks won't be back.

Last night the bar service was absolutely terrible; decided to give them a shot again today. After waiting 25 minutes and no one even coming to my table at the bar to say hello I left Terrible service

My meal was good however, I didn't like that there was a dead fly sitting on the window and ants crawling on the table.  Someone else noticed the same thing.  The manager was notified and it took him way too long to address the issue.

My family and I, party of eight, stopped in for dinner on a Sunday evening, after having played three bball games. It took forever to get basic drinks - tea, water, lemonade - two of our kids ordered burgers but we're never asked how they wanted them cooked. One of our kids ordered endless appetizer wings, which took forever to refill. We watched a table come in after us that got served and checked out before we got a 2nd appetizer refill or desserts. Finally, the server asked if all the orders were on one check to which I answered, "yes", but, then we got two, separate bills. We asked for a manager THREE times...when he did come, he did his best to resolve our issues, even offering to give us a free dessert but we will NOT be returning to this location any time soon!

WOMP WOMP WOMP this place sucks.. from the waiters, to the crowd to the food. Everything is a one star and the service gets a BIG FAT ZERO. They need to gut this whole place and get rid of everyone there.

This was by far the worst experience I have ever had at any Friday's in my entire life. I am a part of the rewards programs on the app and have visited several Fridays up and down the east coast. We came and were not serviced until almost 45 mins of waiting and the waitress was rude and didn't even introduce herself. Before the waitress came over we had to get up and ask the hostess to clean off a table another customer said had been dirty for as long as he was sitting there. The waitress then handed us a menu and walked away as we waited another 30 mins. We eventually decided to leave after spending almost 2 hrs in the establishment without receiving any food or drinks. I would never recommend this location to anyone expecting decent service or come back here again!

This location sucks now. When we first walked in, I was relieved to see that it wasn't packed like some of the other Friday's location in the area. There were PLENTY of tables open, but to my surprise we still had to wait 15 minutes to be seated.  After being seated, we wait another 10 minutes before we were even acknowledged by a waitress. She says, "I'll be right with you guys just give me one second." That second turned into another 10 minutes. At this point I'm just ready to go back home and eat my leftover spaghetti from 2 days ago.  She finally returns and take our drink orders, which was 2 watered down raspberry slushies. She then informs us that there are no nachos or quesadillas left on the endless apps menu. I understand supplies may get low due to the endless appetizers being extremely popular, but sheesh, that just made a bad experience even worst. I was better off going to the ghetto Friday's in Forestville.

Ordered a Mai Tai the first one was great waited 30 minutes on a appetizer. Then another hour to be asked if we wanted another drink or appetizer. It took them a hour  to bring the next drink and about 25 minutes for a appetizer. The bartender which was a male acted as if he was upset that we asked for another appetizer which it was endless appetizers it wasn't that busy we are sitting at the bar only 12 people at a 30 chair bar. Ridiculous I won't be back.  Waiting now for my check which it has been 22 minutes already. So sad..... This is crazy drove 40 minutes for poor service. Watching a server come from the floor to fix a drink for a customer but didn't even wash her hands from bringing dirty dishes from the floor and she just put her hands in the fruit to place on the glass. I am changing my score from a two to a one star.

I was so happy with this location.  I've had horrific experiences at other TGIF locations (Forestville and downtown DC).  This one in Bowie #0274 was A-plus.  We were seated immediately and our server Ayomide was excellent - polite, professional and attentive.  Looking forward to another visit and will ask for him.

I love the food and drinks  but sometimes the service has a High/low  of the hosts and severs are phenomenal but sometimes managers can tend to be rude.  Tarick A server at the Bowie location has shown good service time and time again even through busy nights and many tables

I love this TGI Fridays location. The service was great, the menus were clean, and the food was reliable. I always get my drink on and they make strong long islands. I was pleased! I was happy with this location!

There's a reason I HATE this place.  The food is trash and so are the employees. My party and I were in a rush to leave after we finished our meal. Since I could not locate my server and I asked another server to alert my server that we were ready to get the check. The server told me that she's talking to another customer and completely ignored me. The same server who was not my server came to my table with the receipt in her hands and threw it at my party and walked away. I requested to speak with the manager who then said that she would talk to the employee. The manager's attitude was so nonchalant and dismissive. The manager took all 3 check with our forms of payment and walked away. When the manager returned to our table she brought back 3 coupons for a free appetizer. I declined the coupon. I explained to her that her staff as well as her own behavior was absolutely unacceptable. Upon leaving the restaurant I called the restaurant back and asked to speak with the general manager who did apologize and reversed the charges for my meal only which was unfair considering the treatment my ENTIRE party received from the unprofessional servers and manager on duty.  I've gone so far as so reach out via Twitter. Initially I was told to send an email to Guest Relations which I did. I then received an email asking for my phone number to further discuss the issue. As of the writing of this email I have yet to receive that call. This is the 3rd and FINAL time eating at TGIFriday's and received less than stellar treatment! The visit prior to this incident a server at the Greenbelt, MD location decided to fraudulently charge my card by putting a tip on my card.

I wish I could give this place 0 stars, which is rare for me. Service was horrible: we joined a table of 3 to make a table of 5. The waitress took our drink orders and came back with drinks for 4 out of 5 of us. The waitress never took any empty glasses or dishes off the table - we simply placed them on a nearby empty table. When we finally received the drinks, there was a bug floating in the glass of 2 of them. The replacement drinks had bugs in them! We ordered entrees which never arrived after over an hour. We were offered free appetizers coupons for our next visit which addressed NOTHING that went wrong that day. We were hungry that day - offering us something for the future didn't solve the problem. I love Friday's.... will never again patronize the one in Bowie.

Worst service of my life I went here and sat in the bar area and no bull waited 25 mins just to get a single beer just do yourselves a favor and pass on this place worst service of my life and worker act like they don't care at all about anyone we got one beer in a hour and no one checked on us at all. DO NOT GO HERE AND GO SOMEWHERE ELSE

I will never return.   The customer service is ridiculously horrible . I've never quite seen anything like it - it's almost as if the servers think they're doing you a favor.   The food was not fresh & it had a aftertaste . It was dust/dirty on my food . I'm just heavily disappointed & will not waste my money again.  Customer service is nonexistent nowadays.
Been here many times usually get our favorite Pecan Crusted Chicken Salad. It's usually good but today the chicken is VERY TUFF.
Been a few times. Service is consistently bad. Drink specials are good, but not worth the lack of service. Food takes a while to come out. Plenty of parking. Won't return.

Called to place a take out order for the 12:99 Ribs ( they look good on TV) very nice lady named Jennifer took my order . I picked it up and while waiting glanced at a menu . I was shocked at the prices for a glass of Wine ! 10 bucks for a 9oz glass of very inexpensive wine . One of them on the list costs 8.00 bucks at the Wine store . Crazy . Anyway....  I ordered the ribs, mashed potatoes, and Caesar salad . Ribs were very good ! 4 Stars !!! Mashed potatoes were instant and NO gravy . They had a very odd flavor , I wouldn't-order again , boo- hiss .  The salad was just GROSS!  dried up old lettuce thrown into a container with a couple really stale croutons , just freakin gross .  They had these fancy little hand wipes which were nice but they need to step up the game on utensils . I think they spent more time on the hand wipes then anything else . And NO bbq sauce in my bag .... Needless to say with SO many choices in the area and Crofton,  I doubt I'll be back .  Bummer :( But the Ribs were really good !

Slow service, hostess looked like she hated her job waited 10 min for anyone to acknowledge us, to boot is was a manager not a server that took care of us, horrible she has to pick up for hired help :-/ food wasn't all that to bad TGIF use to be a great place to spend a Friday evening, nor so much anymore 2 thumbs  down

I'm a tough customer to handle. I ask for special requests and crazy things. I had a free coupon for half rack of ribs dine in only. I asked if I can just carry out because I was short on time. Manager insisted I can dine in and just throw it in a to go bag. Maybe he assumed I wouldn't tip if I was to carry out. Nevertheless, was allowed to bag everything up in the end but would have been nice to go from the beginning just to make it easier on everyone.  Ribs and mash potatoes are suprisingly good. Mash potato could use gravy on the side. Salad was a not fresh nor bad. Anything free tastes better they say. Biggest issue is there was a strong scent of Clorox around lunch time. Luckily I was the only person there but would be really terrible if someone was to be dining in at the time

We read the reviews but gave it a chance, hoping those reviews were either isolated incidents or just from people with expectations much too high for a chain restaurant. We were right. The food was decent and so was the service. Nothing to write home about but exactly what we'd expect from a typical chain restaurant. We went on the Tuesday before thanksgiving for dinner, my husband, our 1.5yr old, and myself. We ordered a beverage and entree each for the adults (our child has food allergies so we bring food for her still). Food came out in a timely manner. His entree was excellent, mine was half excellent and half just okay. Server didn't seem too enthusiastic but chances are she is enduring less than $2/hr on a tipped salary min wage and working a Tuesday night can be slow and boring. We were there for food, not to be entertained so what do we care what the server is like as long as we get what we ordered in a timely manner, which we did. She didn't notice that my husband needed a refill on his drink - we did have to flag her down for that, but not a huge deal. Overall decent food and service for a cheap price. We are used to 4 and 5 star, non-chain restaurants. This isn't that. But you know that. It's TGIFridays. It's a solid 3star establishment for food, service, and price. If I were rating it compared to only chains, I'd give it 4 stars instead of 3. It served its purpose. We were well fed. Take the negative reviews with a grain of salt. Everyone is entitled to a bad day, both servers and review writers.
This is a good place to eat and listen to music I love  theyre steak its so juicy. The waiters and waitress. Are great and pleasant. I love this place

Before I complete this review I have to warn you that I am not usually a frequent patron of franchise establishments. I love the home grown authentic places. So when I post a review of a franchise place, I went because of someone else.  This time as with most times it was my 11yr old son's choice for his birthday. Can't deny him his choice. So my expectations are low but how did I still get disappointed?  So I was seated immediately and the place was very clean. Wait staff was friendly. So now let's dig into the food. I ordered the Jack Daniels chicken with added shrimp. Presentation was great but here were the problemS! The broccoli was mushy like it had been sitting in water all day. Great flavor though, but I like mine crunchy. The chicken tasted awesome however it was only slightly warm and not hot like they just cooked it. The potato's actually were the best! I tasted my sons French fries and they were cold but he didn't complain.  So the manager came by and asked how was everything and I said exactly what I said here. She offered to take 20% of the bill. I appreciate that. Which is why I gave an extra star because initially I was going to only give 2. If the food was hot it would have been a 4 clearly.

If you like standing in a puddle of urine between eating a meal or drinking a beer; THIS BUDS FOR YOU!! LOL... This franchise has clearly lost their footing when is comes to a dwindling client base. If you'd like to see customer appreciation than checkout their new competitor and neighbors restroom design directly accross the street; called BJ's.  Now not to be too hard on "Grandpa Fridays"allot of establishments fail to provide the simple luxuray of urinal floor grates but quite frankly it's 2018 damm near. Despite this,  Fridays generated $193.5 MM in FY 2015, has strong branding and the best rewards programs and still fails to provide the basic essentials you would expect from a major brand of such. Very disappointed...

I'm not quite sure what happened to Friday's. I vaguely the time where I used to love coming to Fridays. The environment was warm and the food filled the plate and was the classic American food I know/love. At some point in time about 5-6 years ago maybe I think Fridays made the decision to become more of a nightlife destination. The food took a back burner in place of sweet, sugary cocktail drinks and late night action. This Fridays is definitely fits that mold.  The food here is alright. It's typical American cuisine with all the normal fixins. Fridays usually runs a variety of specials so keep an eye out if you've got a favorite. I've eaten a variety of entrees and they are all good. Nothing wows me but it is exactly what it is, a little heavy on the salt but at a reasonable price. Their Jack Daniels sauce is alright and most of the apps are good. The food is remarkably consistent. The service from my experience is usually pretty spotty. On occasion I've had okay service but in general it's lack luster. You'll get occasional drink refills but there's just not much attention. I've been in both the dining area as well as the bar and it doesn't seem to change.  I'm not sure what TGI Fridays would like to be, nightclub, bar, family restaurant or all in one. The service has slipped and my experience at this Fridays hasn't done much to change what I think.
